articles.author: Justin Fox
articles.title: Malaysia's Back-to-the-Future Reform Wave
articles.description: A 92-year-old who ran the country for two decades and the protege he turned against are reuniting. This should be interesting.

articles.author: Bard Wilkinson, CNN
articles.title: Who will walk Meghan Markle down the aisle, if not her father?
articles.description: Meghan Markle's father, Thomas Markle, has reportedly said he will not attend his daughter's wedding to Prince Harry, prompting speculation over who will walk her down the aisle on Saturday.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/mradamtaylor
articles.title: Joy in Jerusalem overshadowed by death in Gaza
articles.description: As U.S. and Israeli officials celebrated Trump's embassy move, Israeli forces killed scores in Gaza.

articles.title: Warriors put Rockets away with second-half burst in Game 1
articles.description: Golden State absorbed Houston's blows in Game 1 of the Western Conference finals and eventually broke open the game with stellar 3-point shooting and ball movement.

articles.author: Kevin Yao
articles.title: Soft China April investment, retail sales suggest economy losing steam
articles.description: China reported weaker-than-expected investment and retail sales in April and a drop in home sales, clouding its economic outlook even as policymakers try to navigate debt risks and defuse a heated trade row with the United States.

articles.title: 'Torture occurred in this house': Parents charged after police find 10 children living amid feces, garbage
articles.description: Mother denies abuse, torture after her husband is arrested and 10 children are taken into protective custody

articles.author: Michelle Robertson
articles.title: Earthquake rattles Giants game, fans go to bat with geological jokes
articles.description: A small earthquake rattled a San Francisco Giants game Monday night, moments before the Giants' Chris Stratton threw a pitch.

articles.author: Rick Mitchell
articles.title: Tropical Development Already Bringing Rain to Florida
articles.description: Hurricane season begins on June first, but there is already a low chance of some tropical development in the eastern Gulf of Mexico.

articles.author: John DeFore
articles.title: 'Deadpool 2': Film Review
articles.description: Marvel's foul-mouthed antihero learns to play well with others (sorta) in a sequel from 'Atomic Blonde' director David Leitch.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/peter-baker, http://www.nytimes.com/by/gina-kolata, http://www.nytimes.com/by/pam-belluck
articles.title: Melania Trump Hospitalized for Kidney Medical Procedure
articles.description: The first lady is at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center and is likely to remain there for the duration of the week.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/adam-liptak, https://www.nytimes.com/by/kevin-draper
articles.title: Supreme Court Ruling Favors Sports Betting
articles.description: The case concerned New Jersey, but it has implications for other states eager to allow and tax sports gambling. Americans are estimated to annually place $150 billion in illegal wagers on sports.

articles.author: Aric Jenkins
articles.title: Experts Say Missing Malaysian Airlines Flight 370 Was Intentionally Crashed

articles.author: Rebecca Berg, CNN
articles.title: Charge dropped against Missouri Gov. Eric Greitens
articles.description: Attorneys representing the state of Missouri announced Monday they will drop a felony invasion of privacy charge against Gov. Eric Greitens, after the attorney prosecuting the case was named as a witness in the trial.

articles.title: A nanny who killed two children with a kitchen knife will spend the rest of her life in prison
articles.description: Yoselyn Ortega, nanny who stabbed and killed two children in her care, was sentenced to life in prison.

articles.author: William Cummings
articles.title: Stormy Daniels lawyer Michael Avenatti threatens to sue 'Daily Caller' reporters
articles.description: Michael Avenatti, Stormy Daniels' attorney, threatened to "recover significant damages against each" Daily Caller reporter that "participated personally" in writing stories about him.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/alan-blinder
articles.title: It's Not Just Hawaii: The US Has 169 Volcanoes That Could Erupt
articles.description: There are potentially active volcanoes all over the West and Alaska as well as Hawaii, and about 50 are considered high priorities for monitoring. Here is where to find them.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1526386
articles.title: Squall line arrives with damaging wind, hail and potential for tornadoes
articles.description: Several tornado warnings had been issued by 6:30 p.m.

articles.title: Trump Administration's 3 Biggest Ideas For Lowering Drug Prices
articles.description: After criticism that the administration's blueprint for drug prices was vague, the secretary of health and human services zeroed in on actions that he said need only his signature.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bradydennis, https://www.facebook.com/eilperin
articles.title: Scott Pruitt requested, received 24/7 security starting on his first day at EPA
articles.description: The agency's inspector general says it played “no role” in decisions about the administrator's security needs.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: "Not the way I would deal with people," former Defense Secretary Gates says of Trump
articles.description: "Face the Nation" moderator Margaret Brennan sat down with Robert Gates for an interview to air Sunday
